Corrective Action Plan implementation (3-year OCR monitoring)
Class action settlement (negligence, breach of fiduciary duty)

findings.mitigation: **NONE AVAILABLE** - Statutory exclusion of for-profit hospitals with no exceptions

findings.description: CRITICAL: 100% certain eligibility loss causing $12M/year perpetual drug cost increase ($120M NPV); no mitigation available except GPO consolidation offsets
CRITICAL — Walk away if not resolved
CRITICAL — Deal can fail at this stage
HIGH — Seller may reject; negotiate seller note alternative

findings.mitigation: Finance from PE equity/taxable bonds at closing

findings.description: Tax-Exempt Bond Redemption Required (IRC § 141 private activity bond test failure)
findings.mitigation: None—statutory requirement; finance from PE equity or taxable bond issuance at closing
Demonstrate tax minimization strategies reduce impact to 36-43% decline (vs. 64% base case)
PE bargaining power strategy; quality metrics
Lock in 6.0-6.5% rate; interest rate hedge

findings.description: Additional Interest Expense (taxable refinancing 6.5% vs. tax-exempt 4.25%)
findings.mitigation: Lock in taxable bond rate at 6.0-6.5% before closing; negotiate rate cap or interest rate swap to hedge against rate increases
Plan for closing cost (include in purchase price)
None—Ohio Rev. Code § 5709.12 mandatory; negotiate payment plan with county auditor to spread over 12-24 months

Aggressive advocacy strategy: ODH staff briefings, legislative outreach (Franklin County delegation), independent healthcare economist report rebutting OhioHealth market analysis, grassroots community mobilization (100+ patient letters), Ohio Hospital Association engagement. Negotiate purchase price adjustment mechanism if CON denied.
Remediate STARK/AKS violations before closing (unwind ASC or OIG voluntary disclosure)
Emphasize PE enhanced bargaining power (cite 11% rate increase research); provide quality metrics; negotiate 12-24 month grandfather periods

findings.description: Class action settlement (negligence, breach of fiduciary duty)
findings.mitigation: Defend motion to dismiss on Ohio DPA claim; if negligence survives, negotiate settlement; pursue cyber insurance coverage ($7M-$18M likely available)

findings.description: **Physician Change of Control Terminations** (20-50 physicians exercise good reason termination within 60-90 days of closing)
findings.mitigation: Retention bonuses ($3-$7.5M), compensation guarantees (12-24 months), clinical autonomy assurances, selective non-compete waivers

findings.description: HIPAA Ransomware Breach - OCR Penalties + CAP
HIPAA Ransomware Breach - OCR Penalties + CAP
Corrective Action Plan implementation (3-year OCR monitoring)
findings.mitigation: Budget for CAP costs, engage external consultants, phase implementation over 3 years

findings.description: **WARN Act Mass Layoff** (failure to provide 60-day notice before 500-1,000 employee layoffs)
findings.mitigation: **AVOIDABLE:** Provide 60-day notice to employees, Ohio DJFS, local government before layoffs; consult employment counsel; stagger layoffs >30 days if feasible
FMV valuation, charitable asset dedication, community benefit commitments
Emphasize DSH status; Ohio Medicaid advocacy

findings.description: Medicaid MCO rate renegotiation (1-2 of 5 plans, 5-10% reduction)
findings.mitigation: Emphasize Mercy South DSH status; cite Ohio Medicaid network adequacy; commit to continued Medicaid access and charity care
Emphasize network adequacy (Mercy South sole Lancaster hospital, Mercy Regional Level II trauma); provide 30-90 day notice; demonstrate quality metrics

findings.description: **401(k) Accelerated Vesting** (plan termination triggers 100% vesting of unvested employer contributions)
findings.mitigation: **AVOIDABLE:** Continue Mercy 401(k) plan 12-24 months as subsidiary plan; delay termination until natural transition point
PR campaign emphasizing enhanced security, extended credit monitoring, transparent communication
Demonstrate OCR compliance and post-breach remediation (security audits, offline backups, encryption); provide corrective action documentation to payers

findings.description: March 2025 follow-up timing coincides with Q2 2025 transaction closing
findings.mitigation: Proactive buyer communication, escrow negotiation, contractual protection

findings.description: Cyber insurance coverage gap (OCR penalties excluded)
findings.mitigation: Review policy language, negotiate with insurer, argue penalties are compensatory not punitive

findings.description: **Ohio Job Creation Tax Credit Forfeiture** (layoffs violate retention commitment, see Tax Section IV.G)
findings.mitigation: Structure layoffs after credit secured; exclude layoff positions from baseline; create offsetting new jobs (see cross-reference to Tax Section IV.G)

findings.description: October 2024 JC survey: Accreditation with Requirements for Improvement (8 deficiencies)
findings.mitigation: Sustained hand hygiene ≥90%, medication management audits, March 2025 follow-up preparation

findings.description: **Union Successorship Obligations** (if unions exist – pending data room verification)
findings.mitigation: Verify union status via data room review; recognize unions as successors; bargain in good faith over layoff effects; maintain status quo during transition

findings.description: ODH hospital license transfer delay (4 facilities)
findings.mitigation: Submit ODH license transfer applications 60 days pre-closing (vs. 30-day minimum), coordinate with CMS CHOW timeline, proactively address Joint Commission deficiencies before March 2025 follow-up survey to ensure accreditation restoration, provide enhanced financial viability documentation if CON denied.

Submit CMS Form 855A applications 45 days pre-closing, coordinate with ODH license transfer, ensure Joint Commission accreditation maintained (restore by March 2025 follow-up), disclose all PE ownership interests >5% to avoid CMS resubmission requests, request expedited processing.

findings.description: Graduate Medical Education (GME) - Surgery Program Probation
**Accrued Vacation Payout** (Ohio law requires payment at termination)
findings.mitigation: None (Ohio statutory requirement); budget in severance cost calculations
Data room verification of written agreements required
